meanings.definition: A pustule or papule on the skin, especially as a symptom of a disease such as smallpox or chickenpox.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed a red pock on the child's arm.
meanings.sent2: After the illness, her skin was covered in pocks.
meanings.sent3: The pock on his nose made him look like a funny clown.
meanings.sent4: Her face was a canvas of pocks, telling the story of her battle with the disease.
meanings.sent5: The pock on his cheek was as noticeable as a bright star in the night sky.

meanings.definition: A mark or scar left on the skin by a pustule or papule.
meanings.sent1: The old man had pocks on his arms from his youth.
meanings.sent2: The pock on her forehead reminded her of the past illness.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the pock on her nose was a tiny tattoo.
meanings.sent4: The pocks on his back were like a map of battles fought and won.
meanings.sent5: The deep pock on her hand was a reminder of a painful memory.
